titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Robert Edward Minshall Papers, 1909-1913
titlestmt.subtitle: Minshall, Robert Edward, Papers Ms2019-043

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2020-01-07 16:21:48 -0500

titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections Ms2019-043

defitem.label: Processed by: Caroline Harvey, Student Worker, and Laurel Rozema, Archivist,

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: Robert Edward Minshall Papers, 1909-1913, contains photographs, postcards, and programs from Virginia Polytechnic Institute. Minshall graduated from VPI in 1913 and taught civil engineering at Penn State.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from Robert Edward Minshall Papers must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Robert Edward Minshall Papers, Ms2019-043, Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Robert Edward Minshall Papers was donated to Special Collections in August 1959.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Robert Edward Minshall Papers was completed in December 2019.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Robert Edward Minshall (1889-1958) of Piedmont, West Virginia, graduated from Virginia Polytechnic Institute with a B.S. in civil engineering in 1913. He earned his master's from Penn State, where he worked as a civil engineering profesor until his retirement in 1953. He served as a second lieutenant in the U.S. Army Coast Artillery Corps during World War I. Minshall married Nina Virginia Shuey, and the couple had three children.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Robert Edward Minshall Papers contain VPI photographs and programs from 1909 to 1913. There are 30 photographs and postcards, which depict campus, Castle Rock, the Corps of Cadets, Price Hall, Cascades, the 1943 campus flood, VPI walkway, Academic Building no. 1, "Uncle Bill" Witt, and pictures from the 1909 football team. The following football players are identified: Coach Bocock, V.B. Hodgson, A.N. Hodgson, [H.E.] Billups, [W.B.] Davis, [T.P.] Hicks, [J.L.] Hughes, H.G. Jones, [E.R.] Norris, [J.T.] Luttrell, and [A.G.] Gibbs. Additionally, there are two programs from the Class of 1913 Annual Sophmore Banquet and VPI 1913 Commencement.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Some postcards were removed to the Historical Photograph Collection.

controlaccess.head: Organizations:
controlaccess.corpname: Virginia Agricultural and Mechanical College and Polytechnic Institute
